title: Introduction to Guitar Scales
content:
Scales are the foundation of music theory and guitar playing. They are sequences of notes played in ascending or descending order. The most common scales for beginners are:

1. Major Scale - Has a happy, bright sound
2. Minor Scale - Has a sad, melancholic sound

Practice playing scales slowly and focus on clean notes. Use alternate picking (down-up-down-up) for better technique.

title: C Major Scale Practice
content:
The C Major scale is one of the first scales every guitarist should learn. It contains no sharps or flats.

Notes: C, D, E, F, G, A, B, C

Practice tips:
- Start on the 3rd fret of the A string (C note)
- Play each note clearly
- Use your index, middle, and ring fingers
- Practice ascending and descending

Try to play it smoothly without stopping between notes.

title: Understanding Scale Positions
content:
Scale positions allow you to play the same scale in different locations on the fretboard. This is essential for:

- Playing solos across the entire neck
- Understanding the fretboard layout
- Creating melodic variations

Each position uses a different set of frets and strings. Practice moving between positions smoothly.
